awd_abstract_narration: Francis Marion College will initiate a 3-week residential Young                 Scholars project in Physics for 25 students in grade 12.                                                                                                        This project introduces high school students to the excitement and              methodology of scientific research via a three-week residential summer          research camp on modern physics and a monthly program of school year            follow-up activities.  The camp includes classroom discussions,                 laboratory exercises and library research, all designed to encourage            students to function as researchers.  Students begin by investigating           atomic spectra, follow with experiments designed to discover more about         the structure of the nucleus, and finally the project concludes with a          study of elementary particle physics and the quark model of the                 nucleon.  Career exploration activities include invited lecturers,              library research and field trips chosen to expose students to a variety         of scientific careers.
org_div_long_name: Division of Research on Learning in Formal and Informal Settings (DRL)
